This app allows you to set up a vote between people using their smartphone. The vote session takes place over a wifi network.

From this screen, you have three options.
  • Join electorate: join a vote initiated by another person.
  • Votes: set up your own vote.
  • Vote archive: consult old votes to which you participated.

About this app
This app was created in a Master thesis of a student of the Bern University of Applies Sciences (BFH) affiliated to a research group on e-voting
(see the website).

In this screen you can create your own votes. All the votes you have created (but which you didn\'t run) appear on this screen. This allows you to prepare a vote that will be run later.

  • By clicking on one of the available polls, you will enter in the edition screen, where you will be able to modify the vote or to run it.
  • With the button at the bottom of the list of available votes, you can define a new vote.
  • The garbage icon allows you to delete a poll.

In this screen you can define the parameters of the vote.
  • Question: this is the question to which the voter will have to answer to.
  • Options: this is the list of answers out of which the voters will have to choose one. You can add an option by entering a text in the field at the bottom of the screen and validating in with the + button. You can remove an option by clicking on the corresponding garbage icon.
  • Allow blank votes: this checkbox adds or remove an option from the list which represent the "No opinion" vote
  • Start vote: when you have finished defining the vote, you can either press on the "Start vote" button (at the bottom of the screen for phone, at the upper right corner on tablets) or go back using the button in the upper left corner, and saving it. When you save it, you will be able to access it again later in order to modify and run it.

In this screen you have to configure the way to connect to the vote session.

In a first time, you have to indicate your identification (for example your name). The you have to choose which wireless network you want to use. In a third time you have to indicate the group credentials.
  • If you are administrator of the vote, you only have to indicate the wireless network you want to use. For this purpose, you have two possibilities. Either you can use the curently connected wireless network (button \"Use network x\"), or you can choose the advanced network settings where you can choose the network you want to connect to. You also have the possibility to set up an access point on your device. This will work only with a vote with a few participants.
  • If you simply want to join an existing session, you have four options:
    • Use network x: this option allows you to use the network to which you are currently connected. When clicking on this button, you will have to enter the credentials of the vote session that have been defined on the administrator\'s device.
    • Scan QR-code: with this option, you just have to scan the QR-code displayed on the administrator\'s device. The connection to the network and the entering of the session credentials will be done automatically.
    • Scan NFC tag: if your device support NFC technology, you can scan data saved on a NFC tag. The connection to the network and the entering of the session credentials will be done automatically.
    • Advanced network setting: this options allows you to select another network you want to connect to. When clicking on a network, you will have to enter the key of the selected network (if network is not already known) and the credentials of the vote session that have been defined on the administrator\'s device.

This screen displays the information about the vote session.
  • Network name: the wireless network on which the vote session will take place.
  • Group number: the name of the group.
  • Group password: the password that must be shared by all members of group.
  • QR-code: the QR-code containing all these informations that can be scanned by people that want to join the group.
  • Write NFC tag: if your device support NFC technology, this button will be displayed. It allow to to write the information on a NFc tag that will be read by other people.
  • Your identification: your name as you defined it.

In this screen, you, as creator of the vote (also called administrator), have to select the people that will have the right to vote.

This screen shows you all the participant that are connected to the network session. With the checkboxes on the right, you can select the participant to whom you want to give the right to vote.

In this screen, you, as administrator, have to wait that every participant agrees with the content of the vote and the electorate.
Once every participant has accepted the content of the vote, you can start the voting period.

If a participant does not agree with the content of the vote, you can go back to the edition screen using the button on the top left button.
If a participant does not accept the content of the vote just for blocking the vote, you can go back and exclude her from the electorate.

In this screen you can see which participants of the group are included in the electorate by the administrator of the vote. Once the administrator has selected all the participant he wants, you will be redirected to next screen.

In this screen you have to check if the content of the vote is correct. If you agree with it, you can press the red tick button corresponding to your name in the list of participants.

You especially have to check following things:
  • Is the question correct?
  • Does the list of options contain all options?
  • Is every person that has the right to vote in the participant list?
  • Nobody without right to vote should appear in the list!
If one of this condition is not fulfilled, you should not accept the review and ask the administrator of the vote to modify it.
In this screen you have to select the option you want to vote for. When selecting an option, a dialog will be shown asking you to confirm your choice.

This screen shows the progress of the vote. In the list of participant you can see who has not voted yet. If someone is not voting (because of phone problem, boycott, or another reason), you, as administrator of the vote can decide to interrupt the vote by pressing on the "Finish vote" button.

Once everyone has voted, you will be redirected to the result screen.

This screen shows the progress of the vote. In the list of participant you can see who has not voted yet.

Once everyone has voted, you will be redirected to the result screen.

This screen displays the result of the vote

If you were the administrator of this vote and the vote just finished, you can redo the vote by clicking on the "Redo vote" button.

If you access to this screen through the vote archive, you can clone this vote in order to run it again later.

This screen shows a list of all vote to which you participated

When you select a vote in the list, you will be redirected to the screen displaying the result of this vote.
